definitions.definition: human beings; men, women and children

examples.text: At least ten people were killed in the crash.
There were a lot of people at the party.
Many **young people** are out of work.
**older people**
They are just **ordinary people**.
Millions of **working people **are struggling.
It is important to involve **local people** in the project.
poor/rich people
**people of faith** *(= people who are religious)*
Many innocent people were killed.
The local tourist board is trying to attract more people to the town.
a line of limousines carrying very important people
access for disabled people
Working-class people in general get a bad deal from the legal system.
We want to change the way people think.
People want fresh, local food.
He wanted to help people fulfil their potential.
She tends to annoy people.
We encourage people to contact us.
He doesn't care what people think of him.
In the past, people were told to change their eating habits and they went on a diet.

definitions.definition: all the people who live in a particular place or belong to a particular country, ethnic group, etc.

examples.text: the American/French people
black/white people
the indigenous peoples of Mexico
We should strive for peace among the peoples of the world.
The organization campaigns for the rights of tribal peoples.
The caribou have traditionally been hunted by indigenous peoples in the area.
The book contains translations of folk poetry of the Slav peoples.
He researched the customs of the primitive peoples of the Amazon Basin.
the culture of the Basque people
These artists derived much of their imagery from the art of so-called primitive peoples.
The EU was intended to unite the peoples of Europe.
I was elected to represent the people of Bristol.
the native peoples of Siberia

definitions.definition: men and women who work in a particular type of job or are involved in a particular area of activity

examples.text: a meeting with business people and bankers
These garments are intended for professional sports people.

definitions.definition: the ordinary citizens of a country rather than those who govern or have a special position in society

examples.text: the life of the common people
It was felt that the government was no longer in touch with the people.

definitions.definition: the men, women and children that a person leads

examples.text: The king urged his people to prepare for war.
the story of the Zulu leader who died while attempting to free his people

definitions.definition: the men and women who work for you or support you

examples.text: I've had my people watching the house for a few days.
Our people are all highly trained and motivated.
I'm having people to dinner this evening.

definitions.definition: the men, women and children that you are closely related to, especially your parents, grandparents, etc.

examples.text: She's spending the holidays with her people.

definitions.definition: to please everyone by changing your attitudes or opinions to suit different people
to be understood or used in different ways by different people
a man/woman who understands and supports ordinary people

examples.text: He is not only a statesman, but also a man of the people.

definitions.definition: when you say of all people, you are emphasizing that somebody is the person you would most or least expect to do something

examples.text: She of all people should know the answer to that.

definitions.definition: you should not criticize other people, because they will easily find ways of criticizing you

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French poeple, from Latin populus ‘populace’.
